item.title: Frinsted Road, 28th February
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise concerns about the general cleanliness and maintenance of our street. To clarify, household rubbish collection itself is not the issue — bins are collected regularly. However, there is a persistent problem with street litter that is not being addressed. Litter frequently accumulates along the pavements, around the grass patches, and in the general street area, and it often remains there for extended periods. In addition, the grass patches are regularly overgrown and not properly maintained. There are also ripped and damaged flags left hanging from lampposts, which further contribute to the neglected appearance of the area. Overall, the street looks unclean, untidy, and poorly maintained. This is extremely disappointing, particularly as maintaining clean and presentable streets is one of the core responsibilities funded through council tax. Residents reasonably expect a certain standard of upkeep, and at present that standard is not being met. The overall impression of the street is unsightly, which negatively affects the living environment in the neighbourhood. I would appreciate it if this matter could be investigated and appropriate action taken to improve street cleaning and general maintenance. I would also welcome clarification on how often street cleaning and grounds maintenance are scheduled for this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frinsted Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: FRINSTED ROAD 118-112 area, 28th February
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise yet another complaint regarding the persistent dog fouling problem on my street. Directly in front of my home there is a grass patch, and it is constantly being used by dog owners who are failing to clean up after their pets. In addition to the grassed area, there is now dog fouling regularly left on the pavement itself. This situation is absolutely unacceptable. It is disgusting, unhygienic, and presents a clear health and safety risk to residents, children, and anyone walking along the pavement. It is particularly concerning given that this has been an ongoing issue for years. I have been a resident here for over five years, and throughout that time this has been a constant and recurring problem. I have reported it on numerous occasions, yet it continues without any meaningful or lasting improvement. It is extremely frustrating to see irresponsible dog owners repeatedly getting away with this behaviour. I would like to know what further enforcement measures can be put in place to address this issue properly. Whether this involves increased patrols, clearer signage, fines, or other enforcement action, something more decisive needs to be done. Residents should not have to live with this persistent health and hygiene problem. I would appreciate a response outlining what action will be taken to resolve this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frinsted Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
